Bernahl
No
The only chance to get Bernahl's bell bearing is murdering him at his initial location in the Warmaster's Shack in Limgrave. The only other place you see him in person is the combat-free Volcano Manor; when he moves on from there, he leaves his sword behind, which functions as his shop from then on, and at the end of his questline, he doesn't drop it. His shop also adds unique items when you meet him at Volcano Manor, so getting his bell bearing at all locks you out of buying these exclusive Ashes of War.
NPC: Bernahl
Obtained naturally?: No
Notes: The only chance to get Bernahl's bell bearing is murdering him at his initial location in the Warmaster's Shack in Limgrave. The only other place you see him in person is the combat-free Volcano Manor; when he moves on from there, he leaves his sword behind, which functions as his shop from then on, and at the end of his questline, he doesn't drop it. His shop also adds unique items when you meet him at Volcano Manor, so getting his bell bearing at all locks you out of buying these exclusive Ashes of War.
Blackguard
Depends
If you follow both his and Dung Eater's questlines, you can loot his bell bearing once he dies in Capital Outskirts. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds items over his questline, so don't kill him early.
NPC: Blackguard
Obtained naturally?: Depends
Notes: If you follow both his and Dung Eater's questlines, you can loot his bell bearing once he dies in Capital Outskirts. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds items over his questline, so don't kill him early.
Corhyn
Yes
If you follow his questline, at the end in Leyndell, Capital of Ash or Mountaintops of the Giants, reload after finding him for the final time and you'll find his bell bearing. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds items over his questline, in addition to any prayerbooks, so don't kill him early.
NPC: Corhyn
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: If you follow his questline, at the end in Leyndell, Capital of Ash or Mountaintops of the Giants, reload after finding him for the final time and you'll find his bell bearing. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds items over his questline, in addition to any prayerbooks, so don't kill him early.
D, Hunter of the Dead
Yes
Lootable at the end of his questline in Roundtable Hold.
NPC: D, Hunter of the Dead
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: Lootable at the end of his questline in Roundtable Hold.
Gostoc
No
Gostoc never becomes hostile. To obtain his bell bearing, you must murder him at some point. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds a very rare item at the end of his questline, so don't kill him early if you want it.
NPC: Gostoc
Obtained naturally?: No
Notes: Gostoc never becomes hostile. To obtain his bell bearing, you must murder him at some point. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds a very rare item at the end of his questline, so don't kill him early if you want it.
Gowry
Depends
At the end of Gowry and Millicent's intertwined questline, he will die naturally if you side against Millicent. If you side with her, you'll have to kill him yourself, in which case he won't respawn like he usually does and you'll get his loot and bell bearing.
NPC: Gowry
Obtained naturally?: Depends
Notes: At the end of Gowry and Millicent's intertwined questline, he will die naturally if you side against Millicent. If you side with her, you'll have to kill him yourself, in which case he won't respawn like he usually does and you'll get his loot and bell bearing.
Iji
Yes
Looted off his body at the end of his questline at his usual spot in Liurnia. You cannot kill him early. Following Blaidd's quest adds an extra item to his shop and bell bearing.
NPC: Iji
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: Looted off his body at the end of his questline at his usual spot in Liurnia. You cannot kill him early. Following Blaidd's quest adds an extra item to his shop and bell bearing.
Miriel
No
Miriel never becomes hostile. If you murder him, you'll get his bell bearing. You monster.
NPC: Miriel
Obtained naturally?: No
Notes: Miriel never becomes hostile. If you murder him, you'll get his bell bearing. You monster.
Patches
No
Patches never becomes hostile (permanently). To obtain his bell bearing, you must murder him at some point.
NPC: Patches
Obtained naturally?: No
Notes: Patches never becomes hostile (permanently). To obtain his bell bearing, you must murder him at some point.
Pidia
Yes
Looted off his body at the end of his questline in Caria Manor.
NPC: Pidia
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: Looted off his body at the end of his questline in Caria Manor.
Rogier
Yes
Looted off his body at the end of his questline in Roundtable Hold.
NPC: Rogier
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: Looted off his body at the end of his questline in Roundtable Hold.
Sellen
Depends
At the end of her questline, you choose whether or not to side with her in her duel with Jerren. Killing her grants her bell bearing, while siding with her does not, and you will not be able to obtain it thereafter as she stays in Rennala's combat-free library.
NPC: Sellen
Obtained naturally?: Depends
Notes: At the end of her questline, you choose whether or not to side with her in her duel with Jerren. Killing her grants her bell bearing, while siding with her does not, and you will not be able to obtain it thereafter as she stays in Rennala's combat-free library.
Seluvis
Yes
Looted off his body at Seluvis's Rise at the end of his questline. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds items over his questline, so don't kill him early.
NPC: Seluvis
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: Looted off his body at Seluvis's Rise at the end of his questline. His shop inventory (and thus his bell bearing) adds items over his questline, so don't kill him early.
Thops
Yes
Looted off his body in Raya Lucaria at the end of his questline.
NPC: Thops
Obtained naturally?: Yes
Notes: Looted off his body in Raya Lucaria at the end of his questline.
Kalé
Church of Elleh, Limgrave, just north of where you emerge at the beginning. Note that if you want his or any Merchant's bell bearing to bring back to the Twin Maiden Husks, you must murder them, as they never die or turn hostile otherwise.
Merchant: Kalé
Location: Church of Elleh, Limgrave, just north of where you emerge at the beginning. Note that if you want his or any Merchant's bell bearing to bring back to the Twin Maiden Husks, you must murder them, as they never die or turn hostile otherwise.
Nomadic [1]
East of Saintsbridge in northern Limgrave, alongside the road.
Merchant: Nomadic [1]
Location: East of Saintsbridge in northern Limgrave, alongside the road.
Nomadic [2]
At the southern edge of the Mistwood in Limgrave near the road to Fort Haight; a dev message on the ground serves as a shop sign indicating he's nearby.
Merchant: Nomadic [2]
Location: At the southern edge of the Mistwood in Limgrave near the road to Fort Haight; a dev message on the ground serves as a shop sign indicating he's nearby.

Southeast of the entrance to Coastal Cave in southwest Limgrave, under a collapsed ruin of stone.

Near the Forest-Spanning Greatbridge Site of Grace in Altus Plateau.

Nomadic [8]
On a mountain in Mt. Gelmir only accessible by ladders up and down. From the Ninth Mt. Gelmir Campsite Site of Grace, cross the rope bridge to the east, then continue east up the slopes to find a ladder down to the merchant.
Merchant: Nomadic [8]
Location: On a mountain in Mt. Gelmir only accessible by ladders up and down. From the Ninth Mt. Gelmir Campsite Site of Grace, cross the rope bridge to the east, then continue east up the slopes to find a ladder down to the merchant.
Nomadic [9]
Near the Astray from Caelid Highway North Site of Grace, just to the east.
Merchant: Nomadic [9]

Nomadic [10]
A bit southwest of the Southern Aeonia Swamp Bank Site of Grace, near the map fragment pillar.

Isolated [1]
At the Isolated Merchant's Shack in southwestern Weeping Peninsula.
Merchant: Isolated [1]
Location: At the Isolated Merchant's Shack in southwestern Weeping Peninsula.
Isolated [2]
From the Main Academy Gate Site of Grace in Liurnia, face southeast toward the seal teleporter to the outside side of the South Raya Lucaria Gate. Instead of using the portal, run right through it, and follow the path down to the merchant.
Merchant: Isolated [2]
Location: From the Main Academy Gate Site of Grace in Liurnia, face southeast toward the seal teleporter to the outside side of the South Raya Lucaria Gate. Instead of using the portal, run right through it, and follow the path down to the merchant.

Hermit [1]
At the Hermit Merchant's Shack in northern Capital Outskirts.

Hermit [2]
Just up the ravine from the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins Site of Grace. Access by the spiritspring to the west, or the Snow Valley Ruins Overlook Site of Grace to the north.
Merchant: Hermit [2]
Location: Just up the ravine from the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins Site of Grace. Access by the spiritspring to the west, or the Snow Valley Ruins Overlook Site of Grace to the north.
Hermit [3]
In Ainsel River, from the Ainsel River Downstream Site of Grace, face east and head into the big room, climb the stairs to enter the building with the massive Malformed Star enemy on top, and find the merchant inside.
Merchant: Hermit [3]
Location: In Ainsel River, from the Ainsel River Downstream Site of Grace, face east and head into the big room, climb the stairs to enter the building with the massive Malformed Star enemy on top, and find the merchant inside.
Abandoned
From the Worshippers' Woods Site of Grace in Siofra River, climb the scaffolding you can see directly west - climb the ladders, drop down around the corner, cross the wooden bridge, and follow the cave-like path until you can drop down into his room.
Merchant: Abandoned
Location: From the Worshippers' Woods Site of Grace in Siofra River, climb the scaffolding you can see directly west - climb the ladders, drop down around the corner, cross the wooden bridge, and follow the cave-like path until you can drop down into his room.
Imprisoned
West of the Moghwyn Palace, enter the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum and keep to the left to find the merchant at a dead end.
Merchant: Imprisoned
Location: West of the Moghwyn Palace, enter the Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum and keep to the left to find the merchant at a dead end.

6. Fort Haight in the South-East section of the forest in East Limgrave
7. North of Stormhill Shack at the edge of the broken bridge
8. Tombsward Cave, South-East of Fourth Church of Marika in North-West Weeping Peninsula
9. Tombs ward Catacombs, South of Church of the Pilgrimage in North Weeping Peninsula.
10. In Stormveil Castle, from Rampart Tower Grace, go through the North Door and jump to the roof in the East. Keep going this way and you'll find it.
11. Nomad at the entrance to Liurnia Lake
12. Rose Church, South-West of Raya Lucaria

21. Volcano Manor in the area hidden behind the Illusory Wall in one of the hallway rooms.
22. Chest in West Lake of Rot, West of Ainsel River underground. May require Ranni's questline.
23. Consecrated Snowfield, North of the first Grace. Requires Haligtree Medallion
24. Mohgwyn Palace on the edge of the cliffs past the swamp. Requires Haligtree Medallion or completion of White-Faced Varré's Questline.

7. Nomad in Mountaintops of the Giants, near the Ancient Snow Valley Ruins Grace.

1. On a stone tomb south of Summonwater Village in North-East Limgrave
2. Nomad East of Raya Lucaria Main Gate Grace. Requires Glintstone Key gotten next to the Dragon West of Raya Lucaria.
3. Reward from Gideon Ofnir for information on Mohgwyn Dynasty Medallion. Requires either Haligtree Medallion or finishing White-Faced Varré's Questline.

2. Lanskyar Ruins in South East Liurnia Lake
3. Highway Lookout Tower in East Liurnia Lake, North-West of Liurnia Highway North Grace
4. Academy Gate Town South-East of Raya Lucaria Academy. It's in a chest North-West of the Grace.

1. Frenzied Flame Village in North-East Liurnia Lake
2. On the Path Down to the Frenzied Flame.
1. Perfumer's Ruins, North-West of Abandoned Coffin Grace in Altus Plateau, found by going through the "Cowards" path past the Magma Wyrm.
2. Rooftops of Shaded Castle in North Altus Plateau
3. Auriza Side Tomb North East of Leyndell. Open the chest in the room with a lot of benches.
4. Nomad in South/Center Ainsel River
1. Wyndham Catacombs in West Altus Plateau. South-East of Volcano Manor
2. Nomad just North of the Forest-Spanning Greatbridge Grace on the South side of the broken bridge in North/Central Altus Plateau.
3. Cathedral of Dragon Communion in South Caelid, West of Castle Redmane.
4. Crumbling Farum Azula on a roof in the South-West section past a dragon.
Rewarded by Gurranq, Beast Clergyman, after feeding him 9 Deathroot. Alternatively, he will drop this stone when killed.
Found on a corpse inside the mouth of a giant skull, just south-east of Church of Repose. [Map link]
Dropped from the two Night's Cavalry (Only spawn at night) escorting a troll-drawn carriage just south-west of the Inner Consecrated Snowfield grace site. [Map Link]
Found at the east end of the frozen river on a ledge at bottom of the frozen waterfall, just past Great Wyrm Theodorix. [Map Link]
Yelough Anix Tunnel: While making your way through the dungeon, you will find a corpse sitting on an iceshard bridge, go down the ladder just to the right; the smithing stone can be found on a corpse just past the non-boss Alabaster Lord.
Looted from a corpse just below a hugging statue, north of the Haligtree Town Plaza grace site. The stone is guarded by two winged and one red-maned Misbegotten.
After defeating Loretta, make your way down a long ladder and past (not down) the lift to find this stone in a chest.
Dropped from the Farum Azula Dragon that swoops down as you make your way along the curved platform, near the beginning of the area between the Crumbling Beast Grave and Crumbling Beast Grave Depths grace sites. [Map Link]
Starting from the Dragon Temple Altar grace site, head north through the door way and make your way past the assorted Azula Beastman and dog enemies until you find yourself on a narrow platform lined with dragon statues. Head straight and near the end will be a spiral staircase you will climb up on your right. At the top of the staircase, turn left and jump across to the floating stone pillar. Carefully walk along the pillar and jump up to the platform. You can collect the stone near the ledge, guarded by a large beastman and dog.
Dropped from the stationary Farum Azula Dragon sitting at the back of the plaza, south of the Dragon Temple Rooftop grace site. The dragon will constantly rain down red lightning while the path is riddled with Warhawks.
Rewarded by Witch-Hunter Jerren for siding with him at the end of Sorceress Sellen's questline just outside the Raya Lucaria Grand Library.
Rewarded by Nepheli Loux in Godrick's Throneroom (just past the Godrick the Grafted grace site) after completing Kenneth Haight's Lord of Limgrave questline. Unobtainable if Seluvis's Potion was given to Nepheli.
Purchased from Gatekeeper Gostoc in Godrick's Throneroom (just past the Godrick the Grafted grace site) after completing Kenneth Haight's Lord of Limgrave questline. Unobtainable if Seluvis's Potion was given to Nepheli.
Found in a chest just past the Dynasty Mausoleum Midpoint grace site. The player should be careful as the chest is surrounded by a Sanguine Noble and seven 2nd generation Albinaurics.
Dropped from the invading phantom Anastasia, Tarnished-Eater, on the frozen river near the scarab-chasing wolf pack, south of Ordina, Liturgical Town. [Map Link]
Start from the Prayer Room grace site and head north along the walkway. Cross the second stone pillar on your right, falling down to the lower ledge of the tower and finally jumping down to the long walkway with the Erdtree Avatar. At the southern end of the path will be a corpse with the stone on it. [Map Link]
Start from the Prayer Room grace site and head north to the end of the walkway. Jump off the edge to your right, down to a stone beam that is adjacent to a platform with a gazebo and health scarab. Run past and go up another stone beam and at the top, there will be an opening with a chest; the stone can be found inside. [Map Link]
Found in a gazebo behind the stationary Farum Azula Dragon sitting at the back of the plaza, south of the Dragon Temple Rooftop grace site. The dragon will constantly rain down red lightning while the path is riddled with Warhawks. [Map Link]
From the main Leyndell, Capital of Ash grace site, head west and then up a sunken dragon wing. Jump to the crumbling wall where you will find a ladder to climb and then continue up the staircases. At the top of the rampart you will see a wandering gargoyle to your right, jump over the railing onto the soft sand below and you will find a corpse with the stone sitting in front of an eerily familiar building. [Map Link]
Rewarded by Latenna after completing her questline at the Apostate Derelict in the Consecrated Snowfield.
Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree: After completing Millicent's questline and defeating Malenia, Blade of Miquella, insert the gold needle into Malenia's scarlet flower to receive the stone as well as Miquella's Needle.

Elden Remembrance (50,000 Runes)
Weapon - Marika's Hammer
Weapon - Sacred Relic Sword
Remembrance Of The Rot Goddess (50,000 Runes)

Incantation Spell - Scarlet Aeonia
Remembrance Of The Blood Lord (30,000 Runes)
Incantation Spell - Bloodboon
Weapon - Mohgwyn's Sacred Spear
Weeping Peninsula - In the western area past the Church of Pilgrimage.
Liurnia of the Lakes - Northeast of Raya Lucaria, in the waters in front of Raya Lucaria Crystal Tunnel Grace.
Liurnia of the Lakes - Two of them can be found around the Mausoleum Compound Grace in Uld Palace Ruins, north of the Church of Vows. IMPORTANT - These only duplicate Remembrances from Non-Shardbearer bosses.
Mountaintop of the Giants - Just outside Castle Sol in the northern area.
Consecrated Snowfield - Northwest of Ordina, next to the Apostate Derelict Grace
Deeproot Depths - Near the The Nameless Eternal City Grace.
Godrick the Grafted
Limgrave - Stormveil Castle
Raises all attributes by +5
Boss: Godrick the Grafted
Location: Limgrave - Stormveil Castle
Effect: Raises all attributes by +5
Rennala Queen of the Full Moon
Liurnia of the Lakes - Raya Lucaria Academy
Used to respec
Boss: Rennala Queen of the Full Moon
Location: Liurnia of the Lakes - Raya Lucaria Academy
Effect: Used to respec
Starscourge Radahn
Caelid - Redmane Castle
Raises maximum HP, FP, and Stamina
Boss: Starscourge Radahn
Location: Caelid - Redmane Castle
Effect: Raises maximum HP, FP, and Stamina
Morgott, the Omen Knight
Altus Plateau - Leyndell, the Royal Capital
Greatly raises maximum HP
Boss: Morgott, the Omen Knight
Location: Altus Plateau - Leyndell, the Royal Capital
Effect: Greatly raises maximum HP
Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy
Mt. Gelmir - Valcano Manor
Restores 185 HP upon defeating enemies
Boss: Rykard, Lord of Blasphemy
Location: Mt. Gelmir - Valcano Manor
Effect: Restores 185 HP upon defeating enemies
Malenia, Blade of Miquella
Miquella's Haligtree - Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree
Attacks dealt after taking damage recover HP
Boss: Malenia, Blade of Miquella
Location: Miquella's Haligtree - Elphael, Brace of the Haligtree
Effect: Attacks dealt after taking damage recover HP
Mohg, Lord of Blood
Mohgwyn Palace - Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum
Grants a blessing of blood to phantoms
Boss: Mohg, Lord of Blood
Location: Mohgwyn Palace - Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum
Effect: Grants a blessing of blood to phantoms
Phantom Great Rune
Mohgwyn Palace - Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum
Item for online play. Obtained after using the Mohg's Great Rune and invading another world.
Name: Phantom Great Rune
Location: Mohgwyn Palace - Mohgwyn Dynasty Mausoleum
Description: Item for online play. Obtained after using the Mohg's Great Rune and invading another world.
Mending Rune of the Death Prince
Awarded to the player by Fia after completing her questline
Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Formed of the two hallowbrand half-wheels combined, it will embed the principle of life within Death into Order.
Name: Mending Rune of the Death Prince
Location: Awarded to the player by Fia after completing her questline
Description: Rune gestated by Fia, the Deathbed Companion. Formed of the two hallowbrand half-wheels combined, it will embed the principle of life within Death into Order.
Mending Rune of the Fell Curse
Awarded to the player by Dung Eater after following his questline and giving him 5 Seedbed Curse
Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater. The reviled curse will last eternally, and the world's children, grandchildren, and every generation hence, will be its pustules.
Name: Mending Rune of the Fell Curse
Location: Awarded to the player by Dung Eater after following his questline and giving him 5 Seedbed Curse
Description: Loathsome rune gestated by the Dung Eater. The reviled curse will last eternally, and the world's children, grandchildren, and every generation hence, will be its pustules.
Mending Rune of Perfect Order
Dropped by Goldmask after following his and Brother Corhyn's questline.
Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask. A rune of transcendental ideology which will attempt to perfect the Golden Order.
Name: Mending Rune of Perfect Order
Location: Dropped by Goldmask after following his and Brother Corhyn's questline.
Description: Rune discovered by the noble Goldmask. A rune of transcendental ideology which will attempt to perfect the Golden Order.
Defeat Flying Dragon Agheel in Agheel Lake (x1)
Defeat Glintstone Dragon Adula in front of the Cathedral of Manus Celes (x3)
Defeat Glintstone Dragon Smarag, west of Raya Lucaria Academy (x1)
Defeat Magma Wyrm Makar in Ruin-Strewn Precipice (x1)
Defeat the three dragons in Moonlight Altar (x3)
Defeat Decaying Ekzykes, northwest of the Cathedral of Dragon Communion (x1)
Defeat Flying Dragon Greyll in the northeast of Caelid on the Farum Greatbridge (x1)
Defeat Elder Dragon Greyoll in front of Fort Faroth (x5)
Defeat the Magma Wyrm in Gael Tunnel bordering Limgrave (x1)
Defeat the Magma Wyrm in Volcano Manor (x1)
Defeat the Magma Wyrm near Seethwater Terminus to the west of Mt. Gelmir (x1)
Defeat Borealis, the Freezing Fog in the frozen lake in the northeast (x1)
Defeat Great Wyrm Theodorix, north of Albinauric Rise (x1)
Defeat the Tibia Mariner in northeast Limgrave in Summonwater Village
Defeat the Black Knife Assassin in the Deathtouched Catacombs
Defeat the Cemetary Shade in the Black Knife Catacombs
Defeat the Tibia Mariner southwest of Carian Study Hall in east Liurnia of the Lakes
Defeat the Tibia Mariner in the Wyndham Ruins
Inside a chest in Gelmir Hero's Grave
Inside a chest in the Giants' Mountaintop Catacombs
Defeat the Tibia Mariner south of Castle Sol, on a cliff edge
Inside a chest in the Catacombs underneath the Hidden Path to the Haligtree
Just east of the Agheel Lake South Site of Grace is a raised ledge. On the ledge are a few Wandering Nobles digging in the grass at the base of large tombstones, and to the left is one noble standing by himself. Kill him.
In Village of the Albinaurics, find one in a graveyard near the Site of Grace surrounded by first-generation Albinauric enemies.
Just southeast of the Fallen Ruins of the Lake Site of Grace is a Giant Crayfish in the water, separate from the three Giant Crayfish surrounding the small building nearby. Kill the lone one.
Among the rewards of the Resurrection painting.
Sold for 3000 runes by Pidia, Carian Servant, in Caria Manor (accessed by dropping down from Three Sisters).
In the southwestern corner of Caelid, south of the Caelid Highway South Site of Grace, is a crowd of Wandering Nobles milling about amongst sarcophagi. Kill the noble in the back.
From the Rampartside Path Site of Grace (just west of the vertical center of the rampart wall surrounding Capital Outskirts), follow the road north until you come to a building. As soon as you go through the door, look over your left shoulder to see a noble cowering in the corner. Kill him.
From the Road of Iniquity Site of Grace, face east and head to the burning fire you can see. Right in front of it is a flaming enemy. Kill it.
Sold by the Abandoned Merchant for 3000 runes. (To find him, from the Worshippers' Woods Site of Grace, climb the scaffolding you can see directly west - climb the ladders, drop down around the corner, cross the wooden bridge, and follow the cave-like path until you can drop down into his room.)
From the Nokron, Eternal City Site of Grace, head out the eastern door. It's sitting on a body in the building on your right.
Turn right and go down the narrow stairway from the previous description. Before the Mimic Tear boss room is a large gazebo with the Larval Tear on a body in its center, guarded by Silver Tears above.
Dropped by Mimic Tear.
Dropped by Mimic Tear.
From the Night's Sacred Ground Site of Grace, head up the stairs on the right into the building, and kill the large ball.
From the Nokstella, Eternal City Site of Grace, head up the stairs right nearby, and follow them all the way up, through the hall with many Silver Tears and up the stairs beyond, then turn right onto the bridge. You should see a large ball rolling down a far staircase toward you in the distance. Kill it.
After crossing the bridge mentioned in the previous, before climbing the stairs the ball rolled down, enter the building here with a chest in the back. Kill the ball inside.
Following on from the previous two, now do go up the stairs the first ball rolled down. Enter the building at the top. Kill yet another ball inside, or let the Silver Tears do it by triggering a chain explosion.
From the Inner Consecrated Snowfield Site of Grace, head southeast to shortly find three Wandering Pilgrims stranded in the snow. One of them is stuck, buried almost up to his armpits and waddling sillily. Kill him.
From the Main Academy Gate Site of Grace, face southeast toward the seal teleporter to the outside side of the South Raya Lucaria Gate. Instead of using the portal, run right through it, and follow the path down past the Isolated Merchant to its end, where you'll find the inside side of the same south gate. At its foot is the Celestial Dew on a body.
Sold for 5000 runes by Pidia, Carian Servant, in Caria Manor (accessed by dropping down from Three Sisters).
From the Ainsel River Well Depths Site of Grace, proceed into the cave on the left with all the ants. At the first fork, turn right; at the second fork, turn left and hop up some ledges to find the room with the Queen. Proceed out the other side all the way until you come out in the top of the room with Uhl Palace Ruins. From this high ledge, drop onto the beam with a Smithing Stone [4] at the end, then onto a lower ledge against the wall. On this ledge is the body with the Celestial Dew.
Sold by the Hermit Merchant for 7500 runes. (To find him, either from the previous [drop down to ground level and run through the building ahead into the next open area] or from the Ainsel River Downstream Site of Grace [just face east and head back into the big room], climb the stairs in here to enter the building with the massive Malformed Star enemy on top. Inside is the merchant.
From the Ancestral Woods Site of Grace, head directly east until you reach a brazier at the edge of the cliffside. Look over the cliff and jump down onto the bridge-like ruins as safely as possible. At the northeastern end, the bridge slopes down toward a large ruined building that you must drop down into; for extra safety, you can try to use the top of the building wall to break your fall into two halves. From inside this square room, carefully platform down levels and columns all the way to the bottom. The Celestial Dew is in the southeastern corner on a body.
From the Ancestral Woods Site of Grace, leap off the cliff to the rooftop. Jump off the southwestern end to the narrow ledge on the next building, then turn right and follow the ledge around, and jump to the building on your right when you see the Night's Sacred Ground title appear. Continue southwest, hopping over the lip, then turn right and hop up the large stairs. At the top is a body with a Rune Arc. Turn to face northwest, and take a running leap to another building ledge. Turn right, and follow the ledge around until you come upon a body with the Celestial Dew in the back.
From the Night's Sacred Ground Site of Grace, simply head forward and find it almost immediately on a body on the left side of the road.
From the Nokstella, Eternal City Site of Grace, head northwest into the area, staying on ground level as you pass the stairs on your left. Follow the stream past the Silver Tears on the ledge trying to snipe you, then bank north into an alcove on the right. Three Crystal Snails guard a Celestial Dew on a body.
From the Nokstella, Eternal City Site of Grace, follow the stream as far west as it goes, to a large structure at the precipice of a waterfall. (Alternatively, if you have the Nokstella Waterfall Basin Site of Grace, simply head up the elevator and turn left.) Many Silver Tears guard the final Celestial Dew on a body under the structure.
At the top of the shortcut ladder you can drop in Erdtree Sanctuary. To get up there, from the Site of Grace, go outside to the east and climb the root, go through the door, immediately turn left and jump down to the roof, and go through the broken window. Turn right and cross the room to the doorway on the other side with the body and ladder right past it.
Prophecy Painting
Limgrave
Stormveil Castle, in a study room in the heavily guarded courtyard.
Name: Prophecy Painting
Area: Limgrave
Location: Stormveil Castle, in a study room in the heavily guarded courtyard.

Area: Caelid

Mountaintop of the Giants

Area: Mountaintop of the Giants
Location: Southwest of Castle Sol, on the side of a bridge northwest of the Stargazer's Ruins.
Prophecy Painting
Warhawk Ashes
Found inside a study room located at the heavily guarded courtyard where the Omen ogre is. The nearest checkpoint is the Liftside Chamber site of grace.

Rewards: Warhawk Ashes

Resurrection Painting
Juvenile Scholar Cap, Juvenile Scholar Robe and Larval Tear
Start at the "Behind Caria Manor" grace location and head slightly southeast until you arrive at a graveyard, behind a big rock there are a couple Albinaurics you should see the spirit of the artist sitting in a chair.
Name: Resurrection Painting
Rewards: Juvenile Scholar Cap, Juvenile Scholar Robe and Larval Tear
Destination: Start at the "Behind Caria Manor" grace location and head slightly southeast until you arrive at a graveyard, behind a big rock there are a couple Albinaurics you should see the spirit of the artist sitting in a chair.
Redmane Painting
Ash of War: Rain of Arrows
Down the cliff on a plateau south east of the Minor Erdtree in Dragonbarrow. Once you've made your way down, walk to the edge and you'll briefly see the spirit of a painter.
Name: Redmane Painting
Rewards: Ash of War: Rain of Arrows
Destination: Down the cliff on a plateau south east of the Minor Erdtree in Dragonbarrow. Once you've made your way down, walk to the edge and you'll briefly see the spirit of a painter.

Harp Bow
The closest Site of Grace is the Rampartside Path. Head southwest slightly until you see the spirit of a painter.

Rewards: Harp Bow
Destination: The closest Site of Grace is the Rampartside Path. Head southwest slightly until you see the spirit of a painter.

Fire's Deadly Sin

Granted automatically at start of game

Teleport self to Dynasty Mausoleum Entrance Site of Grace; can be used to warp out of any combat safely
Given by Varré at Rose Church, Liurnia, at the end of his various requests

Spend 27 FP to spawn geysers that deal magic damage to enemies

Name: Ancestral Infant's Head
Description: Spend 27 FP to spawn geysers that deal magic damage to enemies
Location: In the submerged ruin in northwestern Ancestral Woods in Nokron, Eternal City; carefully platform to the far side and defeat the Ancestral Follower guarding a chest with this tool

Omen Bairn
Spend 24 FP to conjure wraiths that chase enemies
From the Underground Roadside Site of Grace in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, with shortcuts unlocked, go through the first two doors then down the ladder, and defeat an Omen enemy who drops it
Name: Omen Bairn
Description: Spend 24 FP to conjure wraiths that chase enemies
Location: From the Underground Roadside Site of Grace in the Subterranean Shunning-Grounds, with shortcuts unlocked, go through the first two doors then down the ladder, and defeat an Omen enemy who drops it
Regal Omen Bairn
Spend 50 FP to conjure more wraiths that deal more damage
One of the choices offered when trading in the Remembrance of the Omen King to Finger Reader Enia at the Roundtable Hold
Name: Regal Omen Bairn
Description: Spend 50 FP to conjure more wraiths that deal more damage
Location: One of the choices offered when trading in the Remembrance of the Omen King to Finger Reader Enia at the Roundtable Hold

Tarnished's Furled Finger
Place your cooperative summon sign in online play
In the room with the Stranded Graveyard Site of Grace on a body
Name: Tarnished's Furled Finger
Description: Place your cooperative summon sign in online play
Location: In the room with the Stranded Graveyard Site of Grace on a body
Finger Severer
In online play, return to your world, or send your co-op phantoms home
On the same body as the previous
Name: Finger Severer
Description: In online play, return to your world, or send your co-op phantoms home
Location: On the same body as the previous
Small Golden Effigy
Send your cooperative summon sign to all nearby activated Martyr Effigies at once in online play
Found on the first Martyr Effigy, nearby The First Step Site of Grace
Name: Small Golden Effigy
Description: Send your cooperative summon sign to all nearby activated Martyr Effigies at once in online play
Location: Found on the first Martyr Effigy, nearby The First Step Site of Grace
Furlcalling Finger Remedy
In online play, view summon signs placed by other players, whether cooperative or competitive; item is refunded unless you successfully summon someone
Not reusable, but easily craftable with two Erdleaf Flowers, dropped by invaders including many NPCs, and a frequent loot pickup or shop item.
Name: Furlcalling Finger Remedy
Description: In online play, view summon signs placed by other players, whether cooperative or competitive; item is refunded unless you successfully summon someone
Location: Not reusable, but easily craftable with two Erdleaf Flowers, dropped by invaders including many NPCs, and a frequent loot pickup or shop item.
Festering Bloody Finger
Invade another player as a Bloody Finger in online play
Not reusable, but can be bought in limited quantities from the Nomadic Merchant of East Limgrave, Patches, and the Imprisoned Merchant, and infinitely from the Hermit Merchant in Leyndell. Varré gives you five during his questline.
Name: Festering Bloody Finger
Description: Invade another player as a Bloody Finger in online play
Location: Not reusable, but can be bought in limited quantities from the Nomadic Merchant of East Limgrave, Patches, and the Imprisoned Merchant, and infinitely from the Hermit Merchant in Leyndell. Varré gives you five during his questline.
Phantom Bloody Finger
As an invader in online play, re-attempt your current invasion; useful if you can't find the host
You're automatically granted three of these consumables if you invade someone, and you lose them once the invasion has concluded
Name: Phantom Bloody Finger
Description: As an invader in online play, re-attempt your current invasion; useful if you can't find the host
Location: You're automatically granted three of these consumables if you invade someone, and you lose them once the invasion has concluded
Duelist's Furled Finger
Place your competitive summon sign in online play
At the northern tip of Limgrave at the foot of the ruined round structure, directly next to the ghost, near where Recusant Henricus invades
Name: Duelist's Furled Finger
Description: Place your competitive summon sign in online play
Location: At the northern tip of Limgrave at the foot of the ruined round structure, directly next to the ghost, near where Recusant Henricus invades
Small Red Effigy
Send your competitive summon sign to all nearby activated Martyr Effigies at once in online play
On the same body as the previous
Name: Small Red Effigy
Description: Send your competitive summon sign to all nearby activated Martyr Effigies at once in online play
Location: On the same body as the previous
Taunter's Tongue
Allow your world to be invaded without cooperators present, and for a second invader to join if you have a cooperator. Requires using a Furlcalling Finger Remedy first.
Dropped by NPC invader Mad Tongue Alberich in Roundtable Hold, down off the balcony
Name: Taunter's Tongue
Description: Allow your world to be invaded without cooperators present, and for a second invader to join if you have a cooperator. Requires using a Furlcalling Finger Remedy first.
Location: Dropped by NPC invader Mad Tongue Alberich in Roundtable Hold, down off the balcony
White Cipher Ring
When invaded in online play, summon someone using the Blue Cipher Ring to aid you as a hunter; stays active permanently until you turn it off
Bought from Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold for 1000 runes
Name: White Cipher Ring
Description: When invaded in online play, summon someone using the Blue Cipher Ring to aid you as a hunter; stays active permanently until you turn it off
Location: Bought from Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold for 1000 runes
Blue Cipher Ring
Be summoned as a hunter anytime someone nearby using the White Cipher Ring is invaded; stays active permanently until you turn it off
Bought from Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold for 1000 runes
Name: Blue Cipher Ring
Description: Be summoned as a hunter anytime someone nearby using the White Cipher Ring is invaded; stays active permanently until you turn it off
Location: Bought from Twin Maiden Husks in Roundtable Hold for 1000 runes
Bloody Finger
Invade another player as a Bloody Finger in online play; an infinite Festering Bloody Finger that replaces them in the Multiplayer menu
Given by Varré at Rose Church, Liurnia, at the end of his various requests
Name: Bloody Finger
Description: Invade another player as a Bloody Finger in online play; an infinite Festering Bloody Finger that replaces them in the Multiplayer menu
Location: Given by Varré at Rose Church, Liurnia, at the end of his various requests
Recusant Finger
Invade another player as a Recusant Finger in online play; nearly identical to Bloody Finger, though biases players who've used the Taunter's Tongue
Found on the table with Requests in Volcano Manor
Name: Recusant Finger
Description: Invade another player as a Recusant Finger in online play; nearly identical to Bloody Finger, though biases players who've used the Taunter's Tongue
Location: Found on the table with Requests in Volcano Manor
Phantom Great Rune
When an invader in online play, buffs nearby enemies with the "Blessing of Blood"
You're automatically granted three of these consumables if you invade someone after using a Rune Arc with Mohg's Great Rune equipped, and you lose them once the invasion has concluded
Name: Phantom Great Rune
Description: When an invader in online play, buffs nearby enemies with the "Blessing of Blood"
Location: You're automatically granted three of these consumables if you invade someone after using a Rune Arc with Mohg's Great Rune equipped, and you lose them once the invasion has concluded

Wait!
Strength!
Cave of Knowledge
Reward for beating the tutorial dungeon. It's on a body on the ledge after the Soldier of Godrick.
Name: Strength!
Location: Cave of Knowledge
Description: Reward for beating the tutorial dungeon. It's on a body on the ledge after the Soldier of Godrick.
The Ring
anywhere
Help anyone beat a boss as a yellow phantom. Requires online access. (It was also a digital pre-order bonus.)
Name: The Ring
Location: anywhere
Description: Help anyone beat a boss as a yellow phantom. Requires online access. (It was also a digital pre-order bonus.)
Nod in Thought
Waypoint Ruins Cellar
Sellen
Meet Sellen and become her student.
Name: Nod in Thought
Location: Waypoint Ruins Cellar
Questline: Sellen
Description: Meet Sellen and become her student.
Grovel for Mercy
Murkwater Cave
Patches
When you first encounter Patches, after lowering his health enough, he'll perform this gesture as his surrender. If you stop attacking, the fight will end, and you'll get the gesture unlock.
Name: Grovel for Mercy
Location: Murkwater Cave
Questline: Patches
Description: When you first encounter Patches, after lowering his health enough, he'll perform this gesture as his surrender. If you stop attacking, the fight will end, and you'll get the gesture unlock.
Extreme Repentance
Murkwater Cave
Patches
At any time in Murkwater Cave after befriending Patches, even at the end of his questline when he returns, aggro him again and start another fight. This time, let him get YOUR health down below half. He'll give you this gesture and tell you to perform it. (If you do, he'll back off and de-aggro. Be very careful, because he does not stop attacking, so you have to equip and perform the gesture while also running from him. He won't accept your surrender if you've healed, either; you need to still be below half health.)
Name: Extreme Repentance
Location: Murkwater Cave
Questline: Patches
Description: At any time in Murkwater Cave after befriending Patches, even at the end of his questline when he returns, aggro him again and start another fight. This time, let him get YOUR health down below half. He'll give you this gesture and tell you to perform it. (If you do, he'll back off and de-aggro. Be very careful, because he does not stop attacking, so you have to equip and perform the gesture while also running from him. He won't accept your surrender if you've healed, either; you need to still be below half health.)
Calm Down!
Murkwater Cave
Patches
Open Patches's special chest after he's set up his shop in the cave, then go talk to him about it.
Name: Calm Down!
Location: Murkwater Cave
Questline: Patches
Description: Open Patches's special chest after he's set up his shop in the cave, then go talk to him about it.
Finger Snap
Church of Elleh
Blaidd
Once you've visited Mistwood Ruins and heard a strangely human-sounding howl, ask Kalé about it.
Name: Finger Snap
Location: Church of Elleh
Questline: Blaidd
Description: Once you've visited Mistwood Ruins and heard a strangely human-sounding howl, ask Kalé about it.

Stormhill
Alexander

Name: Triumphant Delight
Location: Stormhill
Questline: Alexander
Description: Help Iron Fist Alexander out of his hole.
Crossed Legs
Stormhill
South of Stormhill Shack is a large piece of debris with a corpse sitting on top in this pose. Interact with it to unlock the gesture.
Name: Crossed Legs
Location: Stormhill
Description: South of Stormhill Shack is a large piece of debris with a corpse sitting on top in this pose. Interact with it to unlock the gesture.
Sitting Sideways
Stormhill Shack
Roderika
Talk to Roderika in her shack until this unlocks.
Name: Sitting Sideways
Location: Stormhill Shack
Questline: Roderika
Description: Talk to Roderika in her shack until this unlocks.
Dozing Cross-Legged
Stormveil Castle
Take the path up the spiral staircase from the Rampart Tower Site of Grace. It's on a corpse on one of the first rooftops, guarded by a Stormhawk with a fire-breathing mask.
Name: Dozing Cross-Legged
Location: Stormveil Castle
Description: Take the path up the spiral staircase from the Rampart Tower Site of Grace. It's on a corpse on one of the first rooftops, guarded by a Stormhawk with a fire-breathing mask.
Bravo!
Varré
After you've beaten your first demigod (traditionally Godrick), but before finding Varré at Rose Church in Liurnia, pop back to his original spot by The First Step. In his place is a glowing message he's left you to come find him, which unlocks this gesture.
Name: Bravo!
Questline: Varré
Description: After you've beaten your first demigod (traditionally Godrick), but before finding Varré at Rose Church in Liurnia, pop back to his original spot by The First Step. In his place is a glowing message he's left you to come find him, which unlocks this gesture.
Patches' Crouch
Murkwater Cave
Patches
At the end of Patches's questline, after he's left Shaded Castle, go back to where you first met him and you should find the boss fog back up. Enter and let the encounter play out.
Name: Patches' Crouch
Location: Murkwater Cave
Questline: Patches
Description: At the end of Patches's questline, after he's left Shaded Castle, go back to where you first met him and you should find the boss fog back up. Enter and let the encounter play out.

Ensha

Name: What Do You Want?
Questline: Ensha
Description: Try to talk to Ensha.
Reverential Bow
Hop over the balcony and get invaded by NPC Mad Tongue Alberich. He'll perform this gesture, and it'll unlock as long as you let him finish.
Name: Reverential Bow
Description: Hop over the balcony and get invaded by NPC Mad Tongue Alberich. He'll perform this gesture, and it'll unlock as long as you let him finish.
Curtsy
Roderika
Level up one of your spirits to at least +4, then talk to her.
Name: Curtsy
Questline: Roderika
Description: Level up one of your spirits to at least +4, then talk to her.
Rapture
Once you have your first Great Rune and the door to the Two Fingers is open, interact with them.
Name: Rapture
Description: Once you have your first Great Rune and the door to the Two Fingers is open, interact with them.

On a body next to fire cauldrons in the center of a camp of Fire Monks in southern Liurnia.

Description: On a body next to fire cauldrons in the center of a camp of Fire Monks in southern Liurnia.

Erudition
Church of Irith
Thops

Location: Church of Irith
Questline: Thops
Description: Give Thops the second Academy Glintstone Key. Required to access multiple puzzle towers, in addition to wearing any Glintstone Crown.

Location: Academy of Raya Lucaria
Description: Perform rebirth or cosmetics with Rennala.
Casual Greeting (option 1)
Ruin-Strewn Precipice
Summon Great Horned Tragoth for the Magma Wyrm Makar boss fight and he'll promptly unlock this gesture upon appearing. You can still then send him home if you prefer to face the boss alone.
Name: Casual Greeting (option 1)
Location: Ruin-Strewn Precipice
Description: Summon Great Horned Tragoth for the Magma Wyrm Makar boss fight and he'll promptly unlock this gesture upon appearing. You can still then send him home if you prefer to face the boss alone.
Desperate Prayer
Gowry's Shack
Gowry
Buy the incantation Pest Threads, which becomes available at a certain point in his questline, then exhaust his dialogue.
Name: Desperate Prayer
Location: Gowry's Shack
Questline: Gowry
Description: Buy the incantation Pest Threads, which becomes available at a certain point in his questline, then exhaust his dialogue.
Heartening Cry
Redmane Castle
Jerren

Name: Heartening Cry
Location: Redmane Castle
Questline: Jerren
Description: Talk to Jerren the festival announcer at Redmane Castle before the Radahn fight, watch the cutscene, and talk again.

Hoslow's Oath
Shack of the Lofty
Volcano Manor
Invade Juno Hoslow as part of Volcano Manor. He'll perform this gesture when you arrive; just let him finish and it'll unlock.
Name: Hoslow's Oath
Location: Shack of the Lofty
Questline: Volcano Manor
Description: Invade Juno Hoslow as part of Volcano Manor. He'll perform this gesture when you arrive; just let him finish and it'll unlock.
